channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: Questions of Weapons and Warnings in Past Barrage on a Shelter
item.description: An Israeli strike last week at a United Nations shelter for displaced Palestinians has generated international scrutiny about the weaponry that was used and the warning system that faltered.
item.dc:creator: By BEN HUBBARD and JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: A Palestinian man carrying an injured child after an Israeli missile struck near a United Nations school on Sunday in Gaza.

item.title: British Citizens Flee Tripoli on Ship as 25 Libyans Are Reportedly Killed in Fighting
item.description: The scenes of anxious foreigners fleeing by boat recalled the mayhem at the start of the Libyan uprising under Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi in 2011.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and SULIMAN ALI ZWAY
item.media:description: Smoke filled the sky over Tripoli on Sunday after rockets fired by one of Libya’s militias struck a tank in the main fuel depot.

item.title: Separatist Cadre Hopes for a Reprise in Ukraine
item.description: The pro-Russian leadership in eastern Ukraine is pressing ahead with a sweeping goal of establishing a lasting government.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW E. KRAMER
item.media:credit: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times
item.media:description: Vladimir Antyufeyev in his office in eastern Ukraine. Last week he was declared the acting prime minister of the Donetsk People’s Republic.

item.title: Kiev Journal: Kiev, a City Divided Over an Occupation Without End
item.description: To some, the barricades in Kiev are an essential reminder of the price Ukrainians paid in blood to protect their freedom, but others want them gone.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
item.media:description: Independence Square in Kiev has become a living monument and is hallowed ground for many.

item.title: European Sanctions Force Russian Carrier to Suspend Flights
item.description: Dobrolet, a low-cost subsidiary of the Russian state carrier Aeroflot, announced that it would suspend all flights as a result of sanctions imposed on Russia by the European Union.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW ROTH and NEIL MacFARQUHAR

item.title: To Evade Russians, Plane Crossed Into Sweden
item.description: An American reconnaissance plane crossed into Swedish air space last month as it sought to avoid being intercepted by Russian fighters, American military officials said.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON

item.title: Nepal Enthralled by Visit of India Premier, Who Hits ‘the Right Notes’
item.description: A fractious country, Nepal has been united in its embrace of Narendra Modi, the first Indian prime minister in 17 years to make a state visit here.
item.dc:creator: By GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India after meeting with his counterpart, Sushil Koirala, in Katmandu, Nepal, on Sunday.

item.title: Rescue Hopes in Landslide Fade in Nepal
item.description: Rescuers have recovered eight bodies of the more than 150 people believed buried, as more rain threatened the continuing search efforts in Mankha.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Disputes Threaten to Derail Audit of Afghanistan Vote
item.description: Three weeks after Secretary of State John Kerry brokered a deal to impose a monitored review of the presidential election runoff, the process came close to collapse over the weekend.
item.dc:creator: By CARLOTTA GALL
item.media:description: An election worker counted ballot papers from the Afghan presidential runoff vote. The audit faced new delays on Sunday.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q. and A.: Dan Washburn on ‘The Forbidden Game’
item.description: A book examines the broad effects golf has had on China, from the poor worker who becomes a golf pro to the farmer whose land is taken to build a new course.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Children receive golf lessons at an exclusive kindergarten in Beijing.

item.title: Fighters From Syria Kill 10 Lebanese Soldiers in Battle Over Border Town
item.description: Dozens more Lebanese soldiers were captured in an armed offensive by Islamist fighters, the country’s army chief said, in the most recent spillover from the civil war in neighboring Syria.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By HWAIDA SAAD

item.title: Airstrike Near U.N. School Kills 10 as Israel Shifts Troops in Gaza
item.description: As Israel began to redeploy significant numbers of troops away from populated areas of Gaza, an Israeli Air Force missile struck near the school entrance.
item.dc:creator: By STEVEN ERLANGER and FARES AKRAM

item.title: China Experiences a Booming Underground Market in Child Surrogacy
item.description: The rise of surrogacy links wealthy couples with poor women, in a murky world of online brokers, dubious private clinics and expensive trips to foreign countries.
item.dc:creator: By IAN JOHNSON and CAO LI
item.media:credit: Sim Chi Yin for The New York Times
item.media:description: A 30-year-old rural woman who asked to go by her surname, Kong, is six months pregnant and will earn $24,000 as a Baby Plan surrogate.

item.title: Earthquake Kills Hundreds in Southwest China
item.description: Many people were missing and more than 1,800 were injured after an earthquake, with a reported magnitude of 6.5, hit Yunnan Province.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW JACOBS
item.media:description: Rescuers carried an injured man on Sunday after an earthquake in a remote area of Yunnan Province in China.

item.title: Extremists Seize 3 More Towns in Iraq After Routing Kurdish Forces
item.description: Militants from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, who swept into the towns and forced thousands of locals to flee the fighting, were within striking distance of the nation’s largest dam.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By TIM ARANGO

item.title: International Education: College of Europe Aims to Produce Well-Rounded Civil Servants
item.description: Long known as a training ground for European Union bureaucrats, the College of Europe faces challenges in its bid to produce well-rounded civil servants.
item.dc:creator: By KRISTIANO ANG

item.title: China Says Nearly 100 Are Killed in Week of Unrest in Xinjiang
item.description: The Chinese authorities have characterized the unrest as terrorism, but Uighur advocacy groups have blamed a sweeping security crackdown.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW JACOBS
item.media:description: Chinese soldiers last week in Xinjiang Province.

item.title: Putin Strives to Harness Energy of Russian Pilgrims for Political Profit
item.description: Celebrations for the 700th birthday of St. Sergius emphasized his role in shaping a unified Russia, a narrative that dovetails with the Kremlin’s political aims.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:credit: James Hill for The New York Times
item.media:description: Russians gathered last month in Sergiyev Posad for a pilgrimage to Trinity Lavra of St. Sergius, the seat of the Russian Orthodox faith and the country’s original monastery.

item.title: Otherworldly Downpour Preceded Landslide in India
item.description: Severe weather hit South Asia in recent days, but the reason for the landslide, in which 158 people were feared dead, was unclear even four days later.
item.dc:creator: By NIDA NAJAR
item.media:description: The Indian National Disaster Response Force has recovered at least 82 bodies after a landslide in a village in western India.

item.title: Hospitals in Gaza Overwhelmed as Attacks Continue
item.description: More than 120 Palestinians were killed in Rafah, Gaza Strip, on Friday and Saturday. Those deaths, and hundreds of injuries, overwhelmed the city’s health care facilities.
item.dc:creator: By BEN HUBBARD and FARES AKRAM
item.media:credit: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times
item.media:description: Medics at a field hospital in Rafah, Gaza Strip. More than 120 Palestinians were killed in Rafah alone on Friday and Saturday.

item.title: Missing Soldier Killed in Battle, Israel Confirms
item.description: The Israeli military said the soldier who had been thought captured by Palestinian militants during a deadly clash on Friday was now considered to have been killed in battle.
item.dc:creator: By STEVEN ERLANGER and JODI RUDOREN
item.media:credit: Uriel Sinai for The New York Times
item.media:description: Israeli soldiers watching Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speak on television at a coffee shop near the border with Gaza.

item.title: Gunmen From Syria Hit Army Checkpoints in Lebanon
item.description: Security posts and homes were also attacked on Saturday by gunmen who were thought to be Syrian rebel fighters working to win the release of one of their own.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By HWAIDA SAAD
item.media:description: Gunmen on Saturday driving away with men in Arsal, a border town in northeastern Lebanon near Syria. Gunmen, identified as rebel fighters from Syria, attacked nine checkpoints, seizing some members of the security forces, Lebanese officials said.

item.title: U.S.-Russia Nuclear Deal Stalls as Tensions Over Ukraine Rise
item.description: The growing confrontation between the United States and Russia has derailed an accord to expand collaboration on nuclear projects, including reciprocal visits to atomic sites by scientists.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID E. SANGER and WILLIAM J. BROAD
item.media:description: Under the arrangement, Russian scientists would have been allowed into, among other places, the heart of the American nuclear complex at Los Alamos National Laboratory in New Mexico.

item.title: Hope Dwindles for Hondurans Living in Peril
item.description: Residents of Chamelecón, the most dangerous neighborhood in one of the most dangerous cities in the hemisphere, face a daily grind of murder and mayhem.
item.dc:creator: By RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD

item.title: News Analysis: The War of Words in China
item.description: After a lull in xenophobia, anti-Western invective is back.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW JACOBS
